data.title: Serena Torrey, Theodore Roosevelt V
data.meta_description: Serena Clare Torrey married Theodore Roosevelt V on Saturday in Chappaquiddick, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Robert C. Gregg, an Episcopal priest, officiated.
data.text:
Serena Clare Torrey married Theodore Roosevelt V on Saturday in Chappaquiddick, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Robert C. Gregg, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

The bride, 32, will continue to use her name professionally. She works in Manhattan as the executive director of business development and corporate communications at New York Media, the parent company of New York Magazine and Menupages.com. She graduated from Brown.

She is a daughter of Marcia H. Torrey of Newburyport, Mass., and James A. Torrey of Greenwich, Conn. Her father is the chief executive of the Torrey Funds, an investment management company in Manhattan, and serves on the board of MicroVest, a Washington organization that helps small companies in the third world. Her mother works in Newburyport as a textile consultant for interior designers. The bride is a stepdaughter of Podie Lynch.

The bridegroom, also 32, is a vice president for high-yield bond sales at Lehman Brothers in Manhattan. He is on the board of the New York League of Conservation Voters. He graduated from Princeton.

He is the son of Constance Rogers Roosevelt and Mr. Roosevelt IV of Brooklyn. His mother is a freelance writer on the subjects of endangered primate species and eco-tourism. She is on the New York board of trustees of the Nature Conservancy, and from 1977 to 2006 was a trustee of the Brooklyn Museum. His father is a managing director and investment banker at Lehman Brothers in Manhattan; he is also the chairman of the firmâ€™s council on climate change. He is a trustee of the American Museum of Natural History and the chairman of the Pew Center on Global Climate Change.

The bridegroom is a great-great-grandson of President Theodore Roosevelt.
